alert.note: Alert for Greenville; Oconee; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western North Carolina and upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, in western North Carolina, Transylvania. In upstate South Carolina, Greenville, Oconee and Pickens. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the Advisory area since 600 PM. This is in addition to 4 to 6 inches that have fallen since Sunday evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Table Rock State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Gorges State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Rocky Bottom and Cedar Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks. Campers and hikers should avoid these areas. When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
